findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the `constant` keyword to decrease gas consumption and ensure that their values cannot be changed.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The contract does not conform to Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: Unused state variables create clutter in the contract, increase its size, and deployment cost.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using uninitialized local variables can lead to unpredictable behavior and potential errors in the contract.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on user-supplied input without proper checks, which can lead to problems during execution.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: The contract does not check if the result of transfer methods is successful, which can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
